name: Simple Baked Chicken Breasts
author: Always Cooking Up Something
summary: Simple basic recipe for cooking up a bunch of skinless boneless chicken breasts.
ingredients: 1 pinch Creole seasoning (such as Tony Chachere's®), or to taste
directions: Preheat convection oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Rub chicken breasts with olive oil and sprinkle both sides with salt and Creole seasoning
Place chicken in a broiler pan
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
Flip chicken and cook until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes more
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
Pour water into the pan, while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon
Add more water if needed to dislodge the browned bits; serve alongside chicken
